text:
My dear fry-end! Plis take a seat here. Bring
down you sit and seat here. Let me geeve you

a shit of paper. Continue writing. Once you
are done, you can peen it over here.... Some

of you may have guessed what I said and some
of you may not. What do you think went wrong

in this? Any guesses? Right! I mixed up the
E and I sound...

Hi, my name is Emmelda and today we’ll be
exploring how the letter I is pronounced in

English. I is very different than any other
vowel. A lot of people get confused with I,

especially, if you are European, because you
pronounce this as E, which is true. Sometimes

I is pronounced as E, but English has many
words and I takes many sounds. So let’s

explore few sounds. The first sound is of
I. Its what we have on our face, like I. Remember,

I as your eye. Yeah! or when you say to the
captain of the ship “ Aye aye sir!” SO

that’s the sound. I! Notice my mouth here.
I go…I open my mouth very big then I come

back. I So this is I, Let’s see
few words Blind. Its Bl..I or eye..nd. Blind.

The I is very very prominent in this sound.
Blind. The next word is Child. Again. I am

gonna go very slow in the beginning and use
my muscles, my facial muscles as much as I

can, so that you get a clearer understanding.
But when I am gonna speak it again or gonna

call these words again I’ll go on a regular
rate of speech so you how it sounds when people

are actually talking to you. Child; yes, its
child. Ok. Its Ch-i-ld. Child. Dime. D-i-me.

Please don’t say it…pronounce this as
da-eem. Its not da-eem but dime. Silent S..i..lent.

Silent. Blind, child, dime, silent. Now let’s
see how many other words we can come up with.

For example with F; we say find and we don’t
say feend. We say find. Or, hive like in bee-hive.

E..F..G as in I will not say G…as in few
other words.. Hmm.. Sign or mine or the number

nine or a glass of wine. Europeans like wine.
so its wine. So its wine, sign, shine, blind,

child, dime…Silent. Dime as in the ten cent
coin in US. Dime and not da-eem. It’s not

daeem. Silent. So, I hope you are able to
understand this sound. It’s the eye as in

your eye or ‘aye-aye captain’, if that
helps you. Moving on to the next sound in

e. it’s not ee but e; make it shorter, e.
For example, Finger, Fing..ger , finger. very

small! Ginger; gin-ger, ginger, whichever,
ginger. Kindle, okay? Now I know K I N D becomes

kind, but again you have many words where
I takes many roles. Kindle and not kind-el.

Kindle. The next is picture; Pic-chu, picture.
Okay, Its Pik-chuh. Can you come up with some

name, which have the e sound, for example,
Hollywood celebrities like Jennifer, Jennifer…Jennifer

lawrence or Brad Pitt. Pitt. So it’s the
e sound and not the ee sound. So you never

call jeneefir or jane-fur, you say Jennifer
. you say..you don’t say Brad Peet, but

you say Brad Pitt. So, the e sound will like
finger, ginger, kindle, picture, Tim or king.

So it’s a e sound. Moving on to the third
sound is the Uh sound. For example, yeah…some

people don’t really…the moment I say get
me a word where I sound like uh, nobody can

guess it very quickly because you don’t
really realize it where I can take the Uh

sound. Let’s see… firm, its not ferum,
its not something, you wont say it…you wont

say it like film. Yes, FILM becomes film but
FIRM becomes firm. Firm. Ok? Moving on is

a bird…b-uh..rd ok or b-ir-d. Mission. Notice
we have both the I sounds here. We have mi-sh-ion

or rather I would say its mission, mi-ssion.
Mission. Condition. A lot of European friends

of mine always mispronounce this as condicion,
because lot of European language has this

word Condicion and it mean…it mean pretty
much same of the word condition. I guess it

was taken from those languages. But this is
condition; you don’t pronounce this is as

eeon. We do… If you go to Singapore, you
will have this thing called ION Orchard. It’s

pronounced as ION Orchard, but this is noun.
In other words, generally, ion comes as un.

So my dear European friend, please do not
pronounce this word as condicion or con-dici-on

but as condition. I guess you must be thinking
like why…how? How can I remember so much,

it’s so overwhelming. Yes I can help you
with that as well. Now let’s know when I

takes the uh sound. I takes the Uh sound when
there are two rules. First rule is when I

comes with R and a consonant. Notice this
word, its I R and consonant. Or if its only

I and R. For example, Sir, bird. You have
word such as girl, shirt. So I R and a consonant

sounds like uh. Then second rule would be
when I and ON. The moment you see I and ON

together, automatically you will get the uh
sound. For example, mission, condition. Look

at this mission, condition or another word
would be fiction, if you like fiction books.

So two rules: I R or I ON gets the uh sound.
I hope you can clear idea where I takes so

many roles. But, let me get you some examples
where so many people actually mispronounce

them and they confuse it with the E sound.
It’s Seat, as in your chair or a sofa, seat.

But when you sit on them, its sit. Seat has
EE, sit has only it sound. Neat…knit. Feet…its

actually knit, when you try to knit something.
So, it’s Neat and knit. You don’t neat

a sweater, you knit a sweater. Feet as in
your legs, feet and fit. Your, you think your

body is quiet fit. Last is seeing. I am seeing
but I am also singing. So it’s seeing and

singing. So that’s about it. It was a very
short lesson, very straightforward. I know

it will be little difficult to understand
or comprehend everything in the beginning.

I would recommend you to read as much as you
can. We have come to the end of our lesson.

I really hope you enjoyed it. If so, please
invite your friends to view this lesson. Until

I come back with a new lesson, stay healthy
and have fun learning English. See yeah!
